title: Introduction
text: integrated Open Discourse database setup work, must set database database locally, e.g. using Docker, described . configuring database setup, can obtain individual data tables R6 class.
code: # od_obj <- OData$new() politicians <- od_obj$get_table_data("politicians")$data # factions <- od_obj$get_table_data("factions")$data # contributions_simplified <- od_obj$get_table_data("contributions_simplified")$data # remove data-heavy variables for replication purposes # speeches <- od_obj$get_table_data("speeches")$data

title: Introduction
text: get_age() function, can easily calculate age politicians. substantive analyses, type profession also interesting. get_profession_groups() takes data.frame information regarding professional occupation, indicated politicians data table, returns data.frame dummy variables indicating profession per group (defined 7 profession categories). investigating background politicians, affiliated state (Bundesland) politically interest. State affiliations get obtained get_state(). data visualization purposes (party research), often desired least advised use colors match parties (factions). get_faction_color() takes care fo yields hex color codes can used visualize parties accordingly.
code: politicians |>    dplyr::mutate(     age = ifelse(       is.na(death_date),       # Alive politicians       get_age(birth_date, round_val = 0),       # Dead politicians       get_age_hist(death_date, birth_date, round_val = 0)     )   ) |>    dplyr::select(first_name, last_name, age) |>     dplyr::slice(1:10) #> # A tibble: 10 × 3 #>    first_name last_name   age #>    <chr>      <chr>     <dbl> #>  1 Manfred    Abelein      77 #>  2 Ernst      Achenbach    83 #>  3 Annemarie  Ackermann    81 #>  4 Else       Ackermann    86 #>  5 Ulrich     Adam         73 #>  6 Rudolf     Adams        94 #>  7 Raban      Adelmann     79 #>  8 Konrad     Adenauer     91 #>  9 Brigitte   Adler        60 #> 10 Eduard     Adorno       80 get_profession_groups(politicians, "profession") |>    dplyr::select(first_name, last_name, dplyr::starts_with("group_")) |>    dplyr::slice(1:10)  #> # A tibble: 10 × 9 #>    first_name last_name group_recht group_wirtschaft group_naturwissenschaft #>    <chr>      <chr>           <dbl>            <dbl>                   <dbl> #>  1 Manfred    Abelein             1                1                       0 #>  2 Ernst      Achenbach           1                0                       0 #>  3 Annemarie  Ackermann           0                0                       0 #>  4 Else       Ackermann           0                0                       0 #>  5 Ulrich     Adam                0                0                       0 #>  6 Rudolf     Adams               0                0                       0 #>  7 Raban      Adelmann            0                0                       0 #>  8 Konrad     Adenauer            0                0                       0 #>  9 Brigitte   Adler               0                0                       0 #> 10 Eduard     Adorno              0                0                       0 #> # ℹ 4 more variables: group_gesellschaftswissenschaft <dbl>, group_agrar <dbl>, #> #   group_journalismus <dbl>, group_handwerk <dbl> get_state(   as.numeric(politicians$id),    electoral_term = c(12, 17) ) |>    table() #>  #>      Baden-Württemberg                 Bayern                 Berlin  #>                     79                     99                     29  #>            Brandenburg                 Bremen                Hamburg  #>                     19                      5                     16  #>                 Hessen Mecklenburg-Vorpommern          Niedersachsen  #>                     45                     16                     62  #>    Nordrhein-Westfalen        Rheinland-Pfalz               Saarland  #>                    142                     36                     10  #>                Sachsen         Sachsen-Anhalt     Schleswig-Holstein  #>                     35                     20                     26  #>              Thüringen  #>                     22

code: @Manual{,   title = {opendiscouRse: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)},   author = {Lukas Warode and Florian Richter},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://open-discourse.github.io/opendiscouRse/}, }

what: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: R package containing functions obtain descriptive statistics conduct various forms analyses using Open Discourse database. package currently development, majority functions already working robustly tested. Currently, package based functional approach, goal provide additional OOP infrastructure using R6 object classes (currently working: OpenDiscourse(), currently working: OData()). One main advantages using OOP framework lies exclusive allocation functions (methods). Users able see available methods, misuse confusions inhibited, ease usage package thus make users easily comfortable working Open Discourse database.

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: can install package devtools::install_github("open-discourse/opendiscouRse").

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: get_age(): Get age politician. get_age_hist(): Get age politician based historic date. get_ets(): Get electoral term affiliations politicians. get_profession_groups(): Get professional group affiliation politicians’ jobs. get_faction_color(): Get color code factions. get_state(): Get state affiliation elected politician (either list direct mandate). get_table_1(): Get main table (Table 1) descriptive summaries database. get_implausible_data(): Get data implausible based specific data table based information.

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: count_data(): Count observations grouping variables. rel_freq_data(): Relative frequencies data grouping one variable.

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: plot_dist(): Plotting distributions group variables. plot_cov(): Plotting coverage (NAs) data tables. plot_count(): Plotting summarized data frames generated count_data(). plot_rel_freq(): Plotting summarized data frames generated rel_freq_data(). theme_od(): ggplot2 theme Open Discourse.
